results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 17-18
results.creator_credit: Mark Callan, Michael Carson, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Phoenix”.
The Return’: A second attack is carried out against the Arthur’s but this time Betty is viciously raped and James beaten severely, all for the sake of 6 stamps. There is a new addition to the major’s with the addition of Russell Howie from Fraud and he fits in well. It appears the Arthur’s knew their assailant as there was no forced entry or alarm activated. Could it be they tricked the Arthur’s by saying it was one of the Major Squad members at the door?Inside Information’: Murdoch gets a tip off about a possible location for a warehouse where the stolen goods from the burglaries are and organises a warrant to raid the factory. Here they encounter Lindy (Nadine Garner), who screams sexual assault against Howie for ripping her clothes off while he tries to detain her. James Arthur is so scared from the attacks on him and Betty that he’s turned his house into a fortress. Peter goes looking for Joe who receives stolen paintings and rare art and could know the identity of the burglars. Unfortunately Peter is overheard making a deal which makes him a target of Internal affairs. James Arthur is found dead in his home in a poor attempt at revenge.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 15-16
results.creator_credit: Julian McSwiney, Kate Woods, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 15 and 16 of the television series Phoenix. Deal or Play’: Due to the recession, aggravated assaults are increasing, especially against the older community. Ian from forensics is trying to match a soil sample from the boots the burglars were wearing at one of the aggravated assaults. The rolex watch that was stolen from Betty and James Arthur’s house turns up at a pawn shop so they desperately try to find the identity of who sold it.Married to the Job’: Chris Faithfull (Peter’s wife) is an undercover drug squad cop. She survives the harrowing experience of having a gun put to her head in an attempt to sniff out the big dealers. Carol and the drug squad hide out in a paddock where a young university student has set up an elaborate drug lab inside a caravan, unfortunately he is not as experienced as first thought as he manages to blow the caravan up, along with the evidence the drug squad needs to charge him.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 13-14
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 12 and 14 of the television series Phoenix. Hard Ball’. Now that the majors know the identity of the bombers they have Pat, Dennis and Nick’s house under surveillance. In order for this to be carried off without incident, they use the neighbour’s house to keep an eye on the boys who are ready to do a runner. Once the raid goes down, Ian from forensics will have only six hours to find evidence to use against the bombers, so timing is crucial.Deal or Play’. Two elderly people are pistol whipped and burgled in their own home. The Majors are desperate to find the intruders and see who they sold the stolen goods to - if they can find the buyers, they will find the suspects. James Arthur is so traumatised from the ordeal he starts to give everyone a hard time, including the gas meter reader.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 11-12
results.creator_credit: Ian Gilmour, Kate Woods, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 11 and 12 of the television series Phoenix Hair of the Dog’, opens with the scene of a body found in a river, the apparent cause of death a gun shot victim. Contrary to their first impressions, Ian from forensics discovers the victim died of a heroin overdose and things start moving again for the Majors. The upstairs brass decides to cut surveillance so the detectives start their own off duty surveillance, watching Nick’s house. The discovery of hair fibres found at the bombing reveals that a dog is connected to the robbers, all they need to do now is find the dog that connects Nick, the house and Dennis.Paradise Tomorrow’. Under continual pressure the bombers are beginning to make mistakes. Dennis screws up a robbery of a disposal store and his identity matches the majors sketch. While the garage is under surveillance Nick steals a car and takes it to there to have chassis numbers drilled out, just like the bomb car. The majors feel they are closing in.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 09-10
results.creator_credit: Julian McSwiney, Michael Carson, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 9 and 10 of the television series Phoenix Shaking the Tree’. The team raids a known gay drug dealer in the hope of flushing out information about Dennis, the number 1 suspect, as they believe the dealer is scared of someone who has been harassing him and it might just be Dennis.Blessed are the Peace Makers’. Blazo is a member of the Special Operations Group who is brought into help the majors with their investigation. Blazo and Goose get on extremely well due to their interest with bombs, so Goose ends up going on an SOG exercise with Blazo and finds that he really is not as fit as he used to be.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 07-08
results.creator_credit: Ian Gilmour, Kate Woods, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 7 and 8 of the television series Phoenix. Old Rules New Games’. Jock is frustrated with the lack of hard evidence in the case so he goes to see his trusty informant (Bill Hunter), to see if he has any information as to who may have any of the left-over stolen explosives. He gets himself into deep trouble when he steals a car that has a baby asleep in the back and it’s left to Jock to see if he can get him out of strife.Fond Memories’. Megan believes the two suspects involved in the bombing are of a violent nature who would not flinch at attacking and raping anyone. On a hunch she investigates a rape case which uncovers a possible suspect that matches the behavior and patterns of the bomber. Dennis is now the number 1 suspect for the Major Crimes unit.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 05-06
results.creator_credit: Julian McSwiney, Michael Carson, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 5 and 6 of the television series Phoenix Laz is still slowing earning the trust of his colleagues as he now believes Balcescu motors had something to do with drilling out the chassis number on the bomb car. Laz is sent through the door first on the ensuing raid, ending his days as an undercover cop for good. Forensic’s can find no link between the bombing and the garage. “Out of the Cold”. After realising that Martin’s Mine was robbed some months earlier, it becomes clear that the explosives used in the bombing came from the mine. On a night out to try and relieve some of the tension between Lochie, Laz, and Peter, Laz finds himself in strife when he protects his Senior Sergeant from the clutches of Francine, a transsexual with an eye for Lochie. He is sent for counselling to try and cope with his aggressive behavior, which in turn brings the team together for Laz has now won the boys trust.

results.title: Phoenix. Eps. 03-04
results.creator_credit: Ian Gilmour, Kate Woods, Bill Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Phoenix”.
Episodes 3 and 4 of the television series Phoenix. “A Bunch of Girls” (directed by Ian Gilmour). This episode brings a new member to the Major Crime Squad, Senior Constable Megan Edwards (Susie Edmonds), the first woman in the squad. Her task is to help with the ever increasing information coming in about the bombing, to see if there are any solid leads, or if it’s just useless crackpots hampering with valuable police time. Megan’s first day on the job does not go well when the accident prone Constable crashes Lochie’s car. “On The Edge” (directed by Kate Woods). Snr Det Lazarus Carides joins the task force. For the last two years he has been working undercover with the Bureau of Criminal Investigation (BCI) looking into a stolen car racket. Inspector Brennan believes the bombers and the car scam are connected and requires Laz’s assistance with some engraved chassis numbers. However, Laz has a hard time fitting in due to his stint as an undercover cop and decides to disappear to do some of his own investigating. A move that does not strengthen relations with his co-workers who view his actions as untrustworthy.

results.title: Dr H. C. 'Nugget' Coombs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian biography”.
Economist, chancellor, patron and advocate of the Arts and Aboriginal affairs, Dr. H.C. “Nugget” Coombs is one of Australia’s most influential public servants and advisor to seven Australian Prime Ministers. Born in Kalamunda, Western Australia, in 1906 (died 1997), Herbert Cole Coombs speaks to interviewer Robin Hughes of how he first became passionate about economics and redressing the issue of racial antagonism, his time at the London School of Economics and his exposure to the inefficiency of the economic system there. He also talks of his years as economist to the treasury in Canberra after the outbreak of war, his role in Rationing, as head of Post War reconstruction, Governor of the Commonwealth Bank, as well as various Arts agencies. Coombs also talks briefly of his working relationship with Chifley, Menzies, Holt, Gorton, McMahon and Whitlam. He also reflects on achievements, regrets and thoughts and fears for the future.
